verses.verse: Then Jonah prayed to the LORD his God from the fish’s belly.
And he said: “I (1 Sam. 30:6; Ps. 120:1; Lam. 3:55) cried out to the LORD because of my affliction, (Ps. 65:2) And He answered me. “Out of the belly of Sheol I cried, And You heard my voice.
(Ps. 88:6) For You cast me into the deep, Into the heart of the seas, And the floods surrounded me; (Ps. 42:7) All Your billows and Your waves passed over me.
(Ps. 31:22; Jer. 7:15) Then I said, ‘I have been cast out of Your sight; Yet I will look again (1 Kin. 8:38; 2 Chr. 6:38; Ps. 5:7) toward Your holy temple.’
The (Ps. 69:1; Lam. 3:54) waters surrounded me, even to my soul; The deep closed around me; Weeds were wrapped around my head.
I went down to the moorings of the mountains; The earth with its bars closed behind me forever; Yet You have brought up my (Job 33:28; (Ps. 16:10; Is. 38:17)) life from the pit, O LORD, my God.
“When my soul fainted within me, I remembered the LORD; (2 Chr. 30:27; Ps. 18:6) And my prayer went up to You, Into Your holy temple.
“Those who regard (2 Kin. 17:15; Ps. 31:6; Jer. 10:8) worthless idols Forsake their own Mercy.

But I will (Ps. 50:14, 23; Jer. 33:11; Hos. 14:2) sacrifice to You With the voice of thanksgiving; I will pay what I have (Job 22:27; (Eccl. 5:4, 5)) vowed. (Ps. 3:8; (Is. 45:17)) Salvation is of the ((Jer. 3:23)) LORD.”
So the LORD spoke to the fish, and it vomited Jonah onto dry land.
